Jean-Noel

> 
> 
> Yeah. I tried using 2.0.1 recently (Was trying to help along the
> hbase-writer effort: http://code.google.com/p/hbase-writer/
> <http://code.google.com/p/hbase-writer/>). I had a
> similar experience. I had to authenticate every time I submittted a
> form and then it'd NPE more often than it'd work. Whats up w/ 2.0.x?
> Is it being used by anyone?
> 
> Was also wondering about the move to Apache-licensing project that was
> talked of a while back up on the list?
> 
> Thanks,
> St.Ack
> 
> Jean-Noël Rivasseau wrote:
>>
>> Hello,
>>
>> I am using Heritrix 2.0.1. <http://2.0.1.>
>>
>> I created a sheet that is associated to www.example.com
>> <http://www.example.com <http://www.example.com>>. This sheet has its
> own root, root:scope, and
>> root:scope:deciderules sequence. However everytime I launch the crawl,
>> it seems like only the settings from the global sheet are used... Eg,
>> if I have there a single RejectRule, the crawl instantly stops.
>>
>> In my experience, Heritrix is awesome as a crawl engine, but
>> configuration is completely buggy. Not only does the web GUI is not
>> very convenient, but so far I have had troubles with it almost
>> everytime I try to use a different sheet than the global one... the
>> only way to achieve something is to use the global one.
>>
>> Am I missing something or should I report a bug? (I already reported
>> several related to the configuration interface)
>>
>> Jean-Noel
>>
>> PS: and trying to mix rules from the global sheet and another sheet is
>> a nightmare, moving them up and down always fail because it seems the
>> indexes are not maintained correctly. This is probably actually not
>> supported.
>>
